FuncDef:
The remark qos-local-id command re-marks a QoS policy ID.
The undo remark qos-local-id command cancels the re-marking of a QoS policy ID.
By default, no action for re-marking a QoS policy ID is configured in a traffic behavior.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a QoS policy ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the QoS policy ID of a VXLAN packet that matches a traffic classifier needs to be changed for a specific application, you can run the remark qos-local-id command to re-mark the QoS policy ID.
Precautions
If the remark qos-local-id command is run more than once in the same traffic behavior view, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
The remark qos-local-id and remark ttl commands cannot both be configured in the same traffic behavior view.
After the remark qos-local-id command is configured in a traffic behavior, the traffic policy that references the traffic behavior cannot be applied to a global UCL or ACL.
When a traffic policy is applied to the VBDIF interface, VLANIF interface, PWVE interface, system, VSI, L3VPN, EVPN, VXLAN VPN, or BD view, the remark qos-local-id command cannot be configured in the corresponding traffic behavior.
In the inbound direction of a VXLAN tunnel, the remark qos-local-id command applies to known unicast traffic, but not to broadcast, multicast, or unknown unicast traffic.
In the outbound direction of a VXLAN tunnel, the remark qos-local-id command can be configured only in Layer 3 access mode.
The remark qos-local-id command takes effect only in VXLAN forwarding scenarios.
If both a QPPB policy and the remark qos-local-id command are configured, only the QPPB policy takes effect.
